pageContext.claim: “We're going to be up to -- getting close to record numbers [in manufacturing jobs].”
pageContext.analysis: Despite the recent gains, the number of manufacturing jobs is still nearly 1 million below the level at the start of the Great Recession in December 2007. The record for manufacturing jobs was reached in June 1979, when 19.553 million were recorded. The current number of manufacturing jobs is 34 percent lower than the record.
